translation: jaundice caused by increased by vali
definition: This is characterised by dyspepsia, peripheral oedema, emaciation of the body, diminished vision and edema of the eyes, malaise, loss of appetite and insomnia.This can be explained by deranged vali influencing azhal affects vyanan. Among the seven udal thathukkal,saram to kozhuppu is affected.
refn: Yugi munivar Vaidhya Chinthamani (perunool 800) First Part; 1976 (2nd ed.), Chennai: Dept of Indian Medicine and Homeopathy, Page No: 367

definition: This is characterised by heaviness of the body, fatigue, yellowish discoloration of urine, evening sweating, redness of the eyes, Excess sleep even in standing, dysentery.This can be explained by derangement of azhal which influences vali and affects vyanan,koorman. Among the seven udal thathukkal,saram to Oon are affected.
refn: Yugi munivar Vaidhya Chinthamani (perunool 800) First Part; 1976, (2nd ed.), Chennai: Dept of Indian Medicine and Homeopathy, Page No:371-372

definition: This is characterised by dryness of the skin,insomnia,dyspepsia,generalised bodyache, diarrhoea,borborygmus,weakness of extremities.This can be explained by deranged azhal which influences Iyam and affects abanan ,vyanan.Among the seven udal thathukkal,saram to Oon is affected.
refn: Yugi munivar Vaidhya Chinthamani (perunool 800) First Part; 1976, (2nd ed.), Chennai: Dept of Indian Medicine and Homeopathy, Page No: 367

translation: jaundice caused by increased azhal iyam
definition: This is characterised by yellowish discoloration of the body,vomiting.Followed by headache,dysentery like milk,dyspepsia,anasarca,pallor of extremities.This can be explained by deranged azhal and Iyam affects vyanan.Among the seven udal thathukkal,saram to senneer is affected.
refn: Yugi munivar Vaidhya Chinthamani (perunool 800) First Part; 1976, (2nd ed.), Chennai: Dept of Indian Medicine and Homeopathy, Page No:369

definition: This is characterised by mucus secretion in eyes,unctuous sweating and anasarca,numbness . This can be explained by derangement of azhal influencing Iyam affects vyanan. Among the seven udal thathukkal saram to seneer is affected.
refn: Yugi munivar Vaidhya Chinthamani (perunool 800) First Part; 1976,(2nd ed.), Chennai: Dept of Indian Medicine and Homeopathy, Page No: 365-366

translation: jaundice with gait distutbances and night blindness
definition: This is characterised by shortening of both UL and LL. Difficulty in walking.Passing bluish discoloration of faeces. Dysuria,burning micturition,tasteless,dimness of vision in the evening, blackish discoloration of the body.This can be explained by deranged vali influences azhal affects vyanan,abanan. Among the seven udal thathukkal saram to Oon is affected.
refn: Yugi munivar Vaidhya Chinthamani (perunool 800) First Part; 1976, (2nd ed.), Chennai: Dept of Indian Medicine and Homeopathy, Page No: 366

definition: This is characterised by yellowish discoloration of urine,anasarca,yellowish discoloration of face,hands,feet and uvula.weight loss inspite of food intake. Depression,dyspnoeic, loss of desire and constipation. It can be explained by deranged azhal influencing vali,affects vyanan,abanan,pranan. Among the seven udal thathukkal saram to sukkilam is affected.
refn: Yugi munivar Vaidhya Chinthamani (perunool 800) First Part; 1976,(2nd ed.), Chennai: Dept of Indian Medicine and Homeopathy, Page No: 370

definition: This is characterised by eye,eyebrows,with greenish hue as Bonduc nut.Yellowish discoloration of micturition,Dysuria and dyspepsia.Increased sensation of heat in the body.It can be explained by deranged azhal influences Iyam affectsvyanan,abanan. Among the seven udal thathukkal saram to seneer is affected.
refn: Yugi munivar Vaidhya Chinthamani (perunool 800) First Part; 1976, (2nd ed.), Chennai: Dept of Indian Medicine and Homeopathy, Page No: 370-371

definition: This is characterised by cardiac dysfunction,malaise.Urine is decreased and concentrated.Pallor of nails,emaciation followed by fever,uvula,tongue,saliva becomes yellowish hue.This can be explained by derangement of azhal influences Iyam affects udanan,vyanan.Among the seven udal thathukkal,saram to Oon is affected.
refn: Yugi munivar Vaidhya Chinthamani (perunool 800) First Part; 1976, (2nd ed.), Chennai: Dept of Indian Medicine and Homeopathy, Page No:371

definition: This is characterised by generalised icterus,continuous cough,sweating in the forehead,difficulty in walking,dyspnoea on exertion,rigor, heaviness of the chest.In this condition,giddiness sets in on intake of betelnut.This can be explained by deranged Iyam influencing azhal and affects vyanan. Among the seven udal thathukkal, saram to Oon is affected.
refn: Yugi munivar Vaidhya Chinthamani (perunool 800) First Part; 1976,(2nd ed.), Chennai: Dept of Indian Medicine and Homeopathy, Page No: 370

definition: This is characterised by pallor of eyes,greenish hue in the eyes,yellowish discoloration of urine and broth-like consistency.Abdominal pain precedes before vomitting at the time of digestion of food.Anosmia,frequent wheeze,dyspnoea and cough.Sleeps like an Peacock. Inability to move like an deadbody. Rolls in bed due to intolerable abdominal pain.This can be explained by derangement of azhal influences Iyam affects udanan,vyanan,kirukaran.Among the seven udal thathukkal saram to kozhuppu is affe
refn: Yugi munivar Vaidhya Chinthamani (perunool 800) First Part; 1976,(2nd ed.), Chennai: Dept of Indian Medicine and Homeopathy, Page No: 372

translation: Spleen disease classified under Vali Humour
spleenomegaly due to vali ,if chronic leads to ascites
definition: This is characterized by dislike to eat,altered taste, bitter taste in the tongue,frequent fever,blackish discoloration of face or whole body,enlargement of abdomen,borborygmus,engorged veins over the abdomen with greenish hue,emaciation of extremities. constipation,Oliguria. If it is chronic,anemia sets in followed by anasarca. This can be explained by deranged Vali influencing azhal and affects udanan,vyanan,abanan. Among the seven udal thathukkal,saram to kozhuppu is affected.
refn: K. N. Kuppusamy Mudaliar (2007). Siddha Maruthuvam - Pothu (7th ed.)Chennai; Department of Indian Medicine and Homeopathy, Page No: 335 - 336

translation: Spleen disease classified under Azhal Humour
spleenomegaly due to azhal with massive enlargement
definition: This is characterized by hypersalivation,bitter taste in the tongue, hatred towards food,vomits after food, bilious vomiting, frequent giddiness, spleenomegaly. Due to the severity,diarrhoea occurs. Body,eyes,tongue,face looks icteric.Sometimes spleenomegaly is so severe that it may reach the lower abdomen. This can be explained by deranged Azhal and affects Vali - udanan,vyanan,abanan. Among the seven udal thathukkal,saram to kozhuppu are affected.
refn: K. N. Kuppusamy Mudaliar (2007). Siddha Maruthuvam - Pothu (7th ed.)Chennai; Department of Indian Medicine and Homeopathy, Page No: 336

translation: Spleen disease classified under Aiyam Humour
spleenomegaly due to iyam with intermittent fever
definition: This is characterized by malaise,pallor of the body peripheral oedema.Engorged veins and varicose veins.If chronic,intermittent fever,bedridden,emaciation ,decreased blood volume and fatal. This can be explained by deranged Iyam influences azhal affects vyanan,abanan. Among the seven udal thathukkal,saram to kozhuppu is affected.
refn: K. N. Kuppusamy Mudaliar (2007). Siddha Maruthuvam - Pothu (7th ed.)Chennai; Department of Indian Medicine and Homeopathy, Page No: 336

translation: Spleen disease classified under Mukkutram Humour
spleenomegaly due to mukuttram,may be fatal
definition: This is characterized by signs and symptoms of vali,azhal and Iya manneeral noi. Massive spleenomegaly,health deteriorates leading to fatality. This can be explained by deranged vali,azhal and Iyam .All the seven udal thathukkal are affected.
refn: K. N. Kuppusamy Mudaliar (2007). Siddha Maruthuvam - Pothu (7th ed.)Chennai; Department of Indian Medicine and Homeopathy, Page No: 336

translation: Thirst disease classified under Vali humour

translation: Thirst disease classified under Azhal humour

definition: This is characterised by increased body temperature, dryness of tongue,uvula,palate.throat,tongue with redness and pricking pain,burning sensation of tongue.This can be explained by deranged azhal affects udanan,vyanan. Among the seven udal thathukkal,saram to Oon is affected.

definition: This is characterised by increased thirst,dryness of mouth due to haemorrhage.Loss of intelligence,dyspnoea.This can be explained by deranged azhal influences Iyam affects udanan,pranan,nagan.Among the seven udal thathukkal,saram to seneer is affected.

translation: Thirst disease classified under aiyam humour

definition: This is characterised by dysphagia, sweet taste in the tongue,dyspepsia,loss of appetite,loss of taste. This can be explained by deranged Iyam influences azhal affects udanan. Among the seven udal thathukkal,saram to seneer is affected.
refn: K. N. Kuppusamy Mudaliar (2007). Siddha Maruthuvam - Pothu (7th ed.)Chennai; Department of Indian Medicine and Homeopathy, Page No 273

definition: This is characterised by thirst due to consumption of increased sweet,salt,easily indigestible food during any illness or after a long walk . This can be explained by deranged Iyam influences azhal affects udanan. Among the seven udal thathukkal,saram to seneer is affected

translation: Thirst disease classified under Mukkutram humour

definition: This is characterised by fever, delirium, diabetes and asthma. This condition has bad prognosis. This can be explained by derangement of mukuttram. All the seven udal thathukkal is affected.

translation: oedema due to vali with pallor
definition: This is characterized by leanness of the body prior to be aware of the disease,pallor,dyspepsia,malaise,dyspnoea on mild exertion,pre-mature browning of hair,impaired sleeping.This can be explained by derangement of vali influencing azhal affecting ranjagam. Among the seven udal thathukkal saram to kozhuppu is affected.

translation: oedema due to azhal with icterus

Deterioration in physical strength and difficulty in walking, giddiness and frequent sweating occurs. This can be explained by deranged azhal, influencing iyam that affects udanan,vyanan. Among the seven udal thathukkal,saram to Oon gets affected

translation: oedema due to iyam with cholera like diarrhoea
definition: This is characterised by generalised pruritus,pallor of the body,fever with rigor on and off,insomnia, continuous diarrhoea as in cholera,giddiness,anasarca,panic striken on and off.This can be explained by deranged iyam influencing vali affects abanan,vyanan. translation: oedema due to mukkutram and fatal
definition: This is characterised by edema, fever, diarhhoea, abdominal pain, anal pain, dislike to food, pain in both UL and LL,dyspnoea on exertion,giddiness,hypersalivation .This can be explained by derangement of mukkutram influencing one another affects samanan,abanan,udanan and vyanan. definition: A disorder characterized by Suram (fever), Valiyudan thol sivantha nirathodudan kanapadudhal (painful reddened rashes) occurring in the course of the sensory nerves. This disease may occur in sudden seasonal changes, decreased thega vanmai (Immune compromised conditions). It is common in summer. It may be explained by Increased Azhal followed by Aiyam or vis a vis and all the seven udal thathukkal gets decreased.

Rougness of skin classified under Vali
Rougness of skin over the feet
definition: It is characterized by cornification in the sole or palm due to constant pressure or friction with hard objects. It may be explained by the increased Vyanan (dryness, thickening, hardness and pain) followed by decreased prasagam (diminished complexion of the affected area). In udal thathukkal Saaram, senner and oon are decreased leading to dryness and hardening of the skin.

definition: It is characterized by erythematous elevated patches with silvery scales in the scalp, palm and sole, with itching, heamorrhagic purpura, cracks in the sole and palm. In chronic stages it affects the nail (Psoriatic nail) and joints (Psoriatic arthropathy - kalanjagavatham) also. It is explained by increased vyanan (Dry and rough skin and swelling of the knee joint, elbow joint and fingers) associated with increased Aiyam (silvery scales) and Increased prasagam (Erythematous patches and bleeding
refn: R.Thiyagarajan(1995),Siddha Maruthuvam- Sirappu (2nd ed.),Chennai; Department of Indian Medicine and Homeopathy, Page No.317

definition: It is characterized by erythematous rashes / soft elevated patches in the skin, itching, pain or tenderness due to unidentified cause. definition: It is characterised by small fleshy or grainy bumps with rough or smooth surface, common in face, neck, upper and lower limbs, rarely painful and grows when put on pressure.It is explained by the imbalance of Vali and Azhal humour affecting Iranchagam and Prasakam of Azhal. Body humours namely Saaram, Chenneer, oon, Kozhuppu gets affected

definition: It is characterised by loss of hair in scalp or body due to malnutrition, stress, certain medications. It is explained by aggravation of Pitham. All the seven udal kattugal gets affected.

definition: It is characterised by chronic inflammation of pilo sebaceous follicles, comedones, papules, pustules, cysts, nodules and often scars. It occurs primarily in the oily areas of skin. It is explained by aggravation of pitham and associated with kabam. Of all the seven udal kattugal, saram, senneer, oon and kozhuppu get affected.
refn: R.Thiyagarajan(1995),Siddha Maruthuvam- Sirappu (2nd ed.),Chennai; Department of Indian Medicine and Homeopathy, Page No.301

definition: It is characterized by premature greying of hair in young adults and even in children. It may be explained by the decreased Ranjaga Pitham and vali which in turn increases Kabam. Among the seven physical constituents Saaram, Senner, Oon, kozhuppu, Enbu and Moolai become decreased.
refn: R.Thiyagarajan(1995),Siddha Maruthuvam- Sirappu (2nd ed.),Chennai; Department of Indian Medicine and Homeopathy, Page No.307

definition: It is characterised by the eruption of small, umblicated, multiple pearled or flesh-coloured smooth, shiny, globular papules, located on the face, trunk and extremities. It may be explained by derangement of Vali. Of the seven udal thathukkal, saaram gets affected.

definition: It is characterised by greenish discolouration of the body, scleroderma, numbness, severe itching, frequent urination, foul smelled body odour. It may be explained by derangement of vatham and pitham. Of the seven udal thathukkal, saaram, senner, oon gets affected.

translation: Miscellanous skin diseases classified under Vali

translation: difficulty in breathing due to increased vali
definition: It is characterised by shallow respiration with difficulty in breathing and the patient may feel a sensation of emptiness of the chest. This is also called as Soothira swaasam. It is explained by increased vatha dosha due to intake of food which is not digested easily, eating food such as tubers, wandering in hot sun etc. the body strength is reduced. The saaram, kozhuppu (dyspnea) gets affected.

It is characterised by dyspnoea with prominent eye ball. There may be dryness of mouth. Patient may be unable to speak; he may appear astonished and will not lie down on the bed; he may look upward as if the mouth is opened; he may also attempt to exhale air and then inhale. It is explained by loss of strength of Udanavaayu, so expiration may not be possible. Among the udal thathukkal saaram gets affected.

definition: It is characterised by nasal obstruction, watery discharge from nose, inability to breathe in and out with intermittent dyspnoea, distension of abdomen due to retention of stool and urine, dryness of tongue, congestion of eyes with pain, pain at the region of reproductive organs, sweating, incoherent talk, feeling sad, occasional behavioural disturbance, giddiness, sensation of rotation of body, etc. It is also called as Vichinna swaasam. This sound simulates the sound of baeting a bronze vessel or it may also simulates the sound which develops during dryness of throat. It is explained by increased kapham and affected saaram.

It is characterised by congestion of throat as if it is ulcerated, ear block, chest pain, breathing difficulty, throat pain as if there is obstruction, deep respiration, pain in rib cap, nausea and uncontrolled cough. The phlegm which comes out because of cough will appear black in colour and found mixed with froth. It is explained by increase in kapha. Udhana vayu activity is increased, praana vayu is also affected. Vatha humour and saaram are affected.

definition: It is characterised by diarrhoea caused by excessive intake of high sour/pungent foods, arsenic medicines, herbs like abrus, semecarpus, plumbago. These substances can cause ulcers and inflammation in intestine and thereby blood appears in diarrhoea. It is explained by aggravation of Pitham and then increase Vatham. All the seven udal kattugal get affected.
refn: Anonymous.1976.Yugi vaithiya chinthamani 800. 2nd edition, Chennai: Department of Indian Medicine and Homoeopathy.pg 160

definition: It is characterised by diarrhoea caused due to fear and depression. It is explained by aggravation of Pitham and then increased Vatham. All the seven udal kattugal get affected.

translation: loose stools caused by evil eye
definition: It is characterised by diarrhoea, indigestion, flatulence and foul smelling stools. It is explained by aggravation of Vatham and then increases pitham. All the seven udal kattugal get affected.

translation: loose stools caused by derangement of Aiyam

translation: indigestion due to derrangement of azhal

It is explained by aggravation of Pitham. of all the seven udal kattugal, saaram, senneer, and kozhuppu get affected

translation: Disorders of ear classified under Aiyam
Hypopigmental patches around the ear due to increasing Aiyam
definition: It is characterised by hypopigmented macular lesions in the skin around the ear. It may be explained by decrease of seneer thathu.
refn: K.S.Uthamarayan(1984),Siddhar Aruvai Maruthuvam(2nd ed),Chennai, Tamil Nadu Siddha Medical Council,Page No.164

translation: Ear blisters like abrus seeds due to increasing aiyam
definition: It is characterised by blisters resembling the seeds of the plant Abrus precatorious causing fleshy odour. It may be explained by the affection of saaram, senneer, oon and kozhuppu.
refn: K.S.Uthamarayan(1984),Siddhar Aruvai Maruthuvam(2nd ed),Chennai, Tamil Nadu Siddha Medical Council,Page No.165

translation: Lymph adynitis in the Ear due to increasing Aiyam
definition: It is characterised by inflammation in the growth in ear, head ache, pain in occipital region, abdominal pain. The swelling may not subside
refn: K.S.Uthamarayan(1984),Siddhar Aruvai Maruthuvam(2nd ed),Chennai, Tamil Nadu Siddha Medical Council,Page No.155

translation: Disorders of ear classified under Aiyam
Inflammation of Eustation tube with discharge due to increasing Aiyam
definition: It is characterised by heat allover the head, swelling, fever with rigor, purulent discharge from ear, Eustachian tube obstruction due to increased iyaam. It may be explained by increase in pitha humour and iya humour.
refn: K.S.Uthamarayan(1984),Siddhar Aruvai Maruthuvam(2nd ed),Chennai, Tamil Nadu Siddha Medical Council,Page No.160

translation: Obstruction of the Eustation tube due to increasing Aiyam
definition: It is characterised by pain inside the ear, headache, heaviness in the occipital region, nasal congestion. It may be explained by increase of kapaha humour.
refn: K.S.Uthamarayan(1984),Siddhar Aruvai Maruthuvam(2nd ed),Chennai, Tamil Nadu Siddha Medical Council,Page No.160

translation: Boils around the ear due to increasing aiyam
definition: It is characterised by papules/boils around the ear. It may be explained by increased aiyam. Also the udal thathukkal senneer and oon are inrecased.
refn: K.S.Uthamarayan(1984),Siddhar Aruvai Maruthuvam(2nd ed),Chennai, Tamil Nadu Siddha Medical Council,Page No.165

translation: Boils with ulcers around the ear due to increasing aiyam
definition: It is characterised by bils, papules and ulcers in ears due to increasing aiyam. It may be explained by increase in saaram and senneer.
refn: K.S.Uthamarayan(1984),Siddhar Aruvai Maruthuvam(2nd ed),Chennai, Tamil Nadu Siddha Medical Council,Page No.165

translation: Boils with pus around the ear due to increasing aiyam
definition: It is characterised eruptions with purulent discharge around the ear. It may be explained by increased kapaham. Saaram and senneer gets affected.
refn: K.S.Uthamarayan(1984),Siddhar Aruvai Maruthuvam(2nd ed),Chennai, Tamil Nadu Siddha Medical Council,Page No.165

translation: Boils with watery appearance around the ear due to increasing aiyam
definition: It is characterised by eruptions with watery discharge from ear. It may be explained by derangement of aiyam and saaram.
refn: K.S.Uthamarayan(1984),Siddhar Aruvai Maruthuvam(2nd ed),Chennai, Tamil Nadu Siddha Medical Council,Page No.165

translation: Pricking pain with accumulation of fluid in the Ear due to increasing Aiyam
definition: It is characterised by increased secretion in ear, sweating, dizziness, tiredness, inflammation, dryness of tongue due to allergy, speech disturbances and ear block. It may be explained by increased pitha humour causing inflammation, the derangement of vatha causes speech disturbances. It may also be explained by decrease in saaram and oon and increase of senneer.
refn: K.S.Uthamarayan(1984),Siddhar Aruvai Maruthuvam(2nd ed),Chennai, Tamil Nadu Siddha Medical Council,Page No.154

translation: Ear carbuncle due to increasing aiyam
definition: It is characterised by carbuncle/abscess inside the ear with watery discharge. It may also be explained by increase of kapha humour. The saaram, senner and oon are affected.
refn: K.S.Uthamarayan(1984),Siddhar Aruvai Maruthuvam(2nd ed),Chennai, Tamil Nadu Siddha Medical Council,Page No.165

translation: Ear carbuncle with tumor mass due to increasing aiyam
definition: It is characterised by a tumour like growth in the ear. It may be explained by the derangement of saaram, senneer, oon and kozhuppu of the udal thathukkal.
refn: K.S.Uthamarayan(1984),Siddhar Aruvai Maruthuvam(2nd ed),Chennai, Tamil Nadu Siddha Medical Council,Page No.165

translation: Disorders of ear classified under Mukkutram
Internal ear infection with discharge due to altered Mukkutram
definition: It is characterised by o6algia, eye pain, pricking pain in jaw, fits (esivu), dryness of tongue, decreased speech, cough, puffiness of eyes. It may be expaines by derangement of vali, azhal and iya thathus. Among the udal thathukkal, saaram and senneer gets affected.
refn: K.S.Uthamarayan(1984),Siddhar Aruvai Maruthuvam(2nd ed),Chennai, Tamil Nadu Siddha Medical Council,Page No.156

translation: Internal ear infection with bleeding due to altered Mukkutram
definition: It is characterised by otalgia, anger due to intolerable pain, occipital pain and pain in lower jaw, sweating in extremities, dryness of tongue, bleeding from ear and diminished hearing. It may be explained by derangement of all three uyir thathukkal and saaram, senneer, oon, kozhuppu and enbu of udal thathukkal.
refn: K.S.Uthamarayan(1984),Siddhar Aruvai Maruthuvam(2nd ed),Chennai, Tamil Nadu Siddha Medical Council,Page No.156

translation: Internal ear infection with accumulation of fluid due to increasing Mukkutram
definition: It is characterised by ear pain, papules in head, hoarsness of voice, eye titednes, pain below the ears and in lower jaw (tempero mandibular jt), lymph node enlargement in cervical region, phlegm in chest. It may be explained by derangement of vali, azhal and aiyam. Also udana vayu gets affected leading to hoarsness of voice. Saaram, senneer, oon, kozhuppu gets affected.
refn: K.S.Uthamarayan(1984),Siddhar Aruvai Maruthuvam(2nd ed),Chennai, Tamil Nadu Siddha Medical Council,Page No.157

translation: internal ear infection due to increasing Vali and influencing the Mukkutram
definition: It is characterised by pounding pain in ear, dryness in tongue, hiccough, emaciation, thirst, sweating, locked jaw, thirst, vomiting of sputum, pain in occiput and eyebrows. It may be explained by derangement of vatha, pitham, kapham. Also, saaram, senneer, oon, kozhuppu thathu gets affected.
refn: K.S.Uthamarayan(1984),Siddhar Aruvai Maruthuvam(2nd ed),Chennai, Tamil Nadu Siddha Medical Council,Page No.158

translation: inflammation of the middle ear due to altered Mukkutram
definition: It is characterised by pain in ear, tinnitus, jaw pain, swelling in lower jaw, heaviness of head, hiccough, vomiting, fever, cough, sore throat, hearing loss. This is difficult to cure. It may be explained by the derangement of, vali, azhal and aiyam. Among the udal thathukkal saaram, senner, oon, kozhuppu, enbu gets affected.
refn: K.S.Uthamarayan(1984),Siddhar Aruvai Maruthuvam(2nd ed),Chennai, Tamil Nadu Siddha Medical Council,Page No.161

translation: Disorders of lips classified under vali
Dryness of the Lips due to increasing vali
definition: It is characterised by dryness of lips with cracks. It may be explained by decrease of saaram.
refn: K.S.Uthamarayan(1984),Siddhar Aruvai Maruthuvam(2nd ed),Chennai, Tamil Nadu Siddha Medical Council,Page No.171

translation: skin lesion in the lips due to derangment of vali
definition: It is characterised by dicolouration of lips, small paules and cracks with bleeding. It may be explained by the affection of saaram and senneer.
refn: K.S.Uthamarayan(1984),Siddhar Aruvai Maruthuvam(2nd ed),Chennai, Tamil Nadu Siddha Medical Council,Page No.171

translation: Disorders of lips classified under Azhal
reddishness of the lips and boils present due to increasing azhal
definition: It is characterised by yellowish discoloration with redness of lips, papules in lips which varies daily. It may be explained by increase of saaram, senneer, oon gets affected.
refn: K.S.Uthamarayan(1984),Siddhar Aruvai Maruthuvam(2nd ed),Chennai, Tamil Nadu Siddha Medical Council,Page No.171

translation: ulcers in the lips due to increasing azhal
definition: It is characterised by swelling of lips resulting in ulcers. It resembles musle mass. It may be explained by affection of saaram, oon.
refn: K.S.Uthamarayan(1984),Siddhar Aruvai Maruthuvam(2nd ed),Chennai, Tamil Nadu Siddha Medical Council,Page No.171

translation: swelling and redness of the lips due to increasing azhal

refn: K.S.Uthamarayan(1984),Siddhar Aruvai Maruthuvam(2nd ed),Chennai, Tamil Nadu Siddha Medical Council,Page No.171

translation: dried lips with bleeding due to increasing azhal

translation: Disorders of lips classified under Aiyam
pale boils in the lips due to increasing aiyam

translation: watery boils present in the lips due to increasing aiyam

translation: Disorders of lips classified under Mukkutram
swelling and boils in the lips due to derangment of mukkutram
definition: It is characterised by swelling of lips on and off, paules of various shapes, foul smelling discharge and cracks in lips. The cure rate is very less. It may be explained by derangement of vali, azhal and aiyam humour. The saaram, senner and oon gets affected.
refn: K.S.Uthamarayan(1984),Siddhar Aruvai Maruthuvam(2nd ed),Chennai, Tamil Nadu Siddha Medical Council,Page No.171

translation: Disorders of Tongue classified under Azhal
Lingular diseases due to increasing azhal
definition: It is characterised by changes in colour, eruptions in tongue (bumps), abnormalities of the surface,coating, pain due to injury, ulcers, taste concerns, difficulty in movements etc. It may be explained by
refn: K.S.Uthamarayan(1984),Siddhar Aruvai Maruthuvam(2nd ed),Chennai, Tamil Nadu Siddha Medical Council,Page No.172

It is explained by the aggravation of vatham. Of all the seven udal kattugal, saaram, senneer, oon and kozhuppu get affected.
refn: kuppusamy mudhaliyar. 2007. Pothu Marthuvam 7th edition, Chennai: Department of Indian Medicine and Homoeopathy.pg 160

definition: It is characterised by continous fever, vomiting, body pain excessive diarrhoea, dehydration, excessive thirst, fainting and incoherent talk. After three days vesicles will appear and gradually increases in size. After tenth day vesicles will disappear. It is explained by aggravatin of vatham and the pitham. Of all the seven udal kattugal, saaram, senneer, oon and kozhuppu get affected.

definition: It is characterised by continous fever for three days, vesicles appears on fourth day and later develops into pustules. Itching, anal pain and diarrhoea also present. Of all the seven udal kattugal, saaram, senneer, oon and kozhuppu get affected.

Of all the seven udal kattugal, saaram, senneer, oon and kozhuppu get affected.

definition: It is characterised by fever, rigor associated with body pain, incoherent talk, sweating, swelling of neck, bilious vomiting and fatigue. In Women, menorrhagia like bleeding will appear. It is explained by the aggravation of

There may be heamaturia due to urinary tract infections and multiple pustules on head. On eleventh day, pustules will disappear. It is explained by aggravation of pitham and then kabham. On seventh day the vesicles will dry. It is explained by aggravation of pitham and then increases vatham. Of all the seven udal kattugal, saaram, senneer, oon and kozhuppu get affected.

definition: It is characterised by continous fever for three days. After three days pustules will develops and gradually increase in size day by day. After ninth day pustules will dry. It is explained by the aggravtion of Pitham and then increases Kabham. Of all the seven udal kattugal, saaram, senneer, oon and kozhuppu get affected.

definition: It is characterised by continous fever for three days, vesicles appears on fourth day and later associated with frequent sweating with salty odour, giddiness, fainting, tiredness and dyspnoea. It usually subsides in seven days. It is explained by aggravation of pitham and then increases vatham. Of all the seven udal kattugal, saaram, senneer, oon and kozhuppu get affected.

It is explained by aggravation of pitham. Of all the seven udal kattugal, saaram, senneer, oon and kozhuppu get affected.

definition: It is characterised by high fever associated with loss of appetite, vesicles appears on third day and subside by nineth day, phlegm in chest, dyspnoea and later deafness. It is explained by aggravation of Pitham and then increases vatham. Of all the seven udal kattugal, saaram, senneer, oon and kozhuppu get affected.

definition: It is characterised by slight fever in the evening times, fatigue, anorexia, indigestion and tuberculi infection of gut. Gradual enlargement of liver and kidney, frequent urination, dysuria, atonic bladder and severe pain in posterior portion of hip. it is explained by aggravation of kabam and then increases pitham. all the seven udal katugal get affected

Rash over the nose, cheek, toes, upper and lower limbs, chronic ulcer, pain in the ribs during respiration, throbbing pain, difficulty in lying down on bed, severe dyspnoea, low pulse rage, cold extremities, viscous sweating and later inability to speak are also present. It is explained by the aggravation of kabam associated with pitham. all the seven udal kattugal get affect
refn: K. N. Kuppusamy Mudaliar (2007). Siddha Maruthuvam - Pothu (7th ed.)Chennai; Department of Indian Medicine and Homeopathy, Page No 249

Frequent nasal obstruction with sneezing and cough, purulent thick nasal discharge, ulcers in nasal septum and swellling around nose are also present. hoarseness of voice, excessive phlegm in larynx, swelling along the side of larynx and ulcers in the larynx. Swelling around the neck and axilla, swelling gradually increase in size and discharge out from

translation: Watery loose stools and vomiting caused by increased Vali
definition: It is characterised by diarrhoea associated with vomiting, giddiness, coldness of extremities, body pain, cramps, thirst, abdominal pain, distended abdomen, sunken eyes, depression, fever and flatulence . It is explained by aggravation of Vatham. All the seven udal kattugal get affected.

refn: kuppusamy mudhaliyar. 2007. Pothu Marthuvam 7th edition, Chennai: Department of Indian Medicine and Homoeopathy.pg 427

translation: Watery loose stools and vomiting caused by increased Azhal
definition: It is characterised by frequent diarrhoea, stuffy ear, excessive thirst, blood and pus discharge, dryness of tongue and swampness over the body. Black discolouration of ski, vomiting, dyspnoea and fainting may leads to death. It is explained by aggravation of pitham associated with kabam. All the seven udal kattugal get affected.

refn: kuppusamy mudhaliyar. 2007. Pothu Marthuvam 7th edition, Chennai: Department of Indian Medicine and Homoeopathy.pg 428

translation: Watery loose stools and vomiting caused by increased Aiyam
definition: It is characterised by vomiting and diarrhoea associated with excessive thirst, emaciation, sunken eyes, pallor , cold extremities and dyspnoea. It is explained by the aggravation of Kabam and then increases Vatham. All seven udalkattugal get affected.

translation: intestinal tuberculosis caused by increased Vali
definition: It is characterised by anorexia, indigestion, diarrhoea with pus, cough, fever, boils and emaciation. It is explained by aggravation of kabam and then increases vatham. All the seven udal kattugal get affected.

translation: intestinal tuberculosis caused by increased Azhal
definition: It is characterised by unbearable abdominal pain, distended abdomen, fever, cough, boils associated with vomiting and giddiness. It is explained by aggravation of Pitham and then increases vatham. All the seven udal kattugal get affected.

translation: intestinal tuberculosis caused by increased aiyam
definition: It is characterised by vomiting, vomitus with pus, emaciaition, giddiness, mild fever, ulcers and pallor. It is explained by the aggravtion of kabam associated with pitham. All the seven udal kattugal get affected

translation: intestinal tuberculosis caused by derangement of Mukkutram
definition: It is characterised by throat pain, dyspepsia, depression, sleeplessness, itching and cough with expectoration. Sputum with foul smelling are also present.

It is characterised by anorexia, hypersomnia, sauntering and wandering attitude, lassitude, defective articulation, dislike towards snack items, gaining body weight and turning to dark colour and impaired hearing. It may be explained by increased vatham. Of the seven udal thathukkal Saaram ,Senner,Oon gets affected.
refn: R.Thiyagarajan(1995),Siddha Maruthuvam- Sirappu (2nd ed.),Chennai; Department of Indian Medicine and Homeopathy, Page No.85

definition: It is characterised by bilious vomiting, belching, hiccough, excessive appetite and thirsty even after intake of food and water, anger, disrespect attitude, blushing of face, eye, mouth and all over the body, looking differently and cruelly, talking continuously, wandering like a demon, increased salivary secretion, dryness of mouth. It may be explained by increased pitham. Of the seven udal thathukkal Saaram ,Senner gets affected.
refn: R.Thiyagarajan(1995),Siddha Maruthuvam- Sirappu (2nd ed.),Chennai; Department of Indian Medicine and Homeopathy, Page No.86

definition: It is characterised by blackish discolouration of the body, dryness of mouth, tongue and teeth, loss of appetite and thirst and retraction of penis. It may be explained by increased kapam. Of the seven udal thathukkal Saaram gets affected.
refn: R.Thiyagarajan(1995),Siddha Maruthuvam- Sirappu (2nd ed.),Chennai; Department of Indian Medicine and Homeopathy, Page No.86

translation: catatonic withdrawal with raising up and lying down
definition: It is characterised by closing eyes, not uttering to speak, rising and lying down suddenly, body is felt very chill due to hyperhydrosis, grinding the teeth, does not care about the dust, slush or mud and lies on it, frequently changing the sitting place. It may be explained by increased vatham. Of the seven udal thathukkal Saaram gets affected
refn: Annonymous.1997.Agasthiyar maanidar kirukkugal pathinetukkum kirigai nool 64.1st edition.Thamarai noolagam.Pg.85

translation: Manica excitement with running like fugitive
definition: It is characterised by wandering in the streets, hug the females, embracing them showing aggressiveness on both sex, bump on some one’s head, spitting on their face, smiling on seeing his relatives and shows hostile on unknown person, being cheeky on audacious dressing, eating excessively. It may be explained by increased vatham. Of the seven udal thathukkal Saaram gets affected.
refn: Annonymous.1997.Agasthiyar maanidar kirukkugal pathinetukkum kirigai nool 64.1st edition.Thamarai noolagam.Pg.87

translation: Catatonic excitement with meanining less talking
definition: It is characterised by folding the fingers, never stretch them out crying with tears for every 24 minutes, non- staying in one place, never lie down, lighting fire on the house, sometimes laughing and moaning. It may be explained by increased vatham. Of the seven udal thathukkal Saaram gets affected.
refn: Annonymous.1997.Agasthiyar maanidar kirukkugal pathinetukkum kirigai nool 64.1st edition.Thamarai noolagam.Pg.91

definition: It is characterised by lamentation, spasmodic tremor, engorgement of the veins, screaming, involuntary movements of the head, always crying, reddish discolouration of eyes, scratching the body, dribbling of saliva. It may be explained by increased vatham. Of the seven udal thathukkal Saaram gets affected.
refn: Annonymous.1997.Agasthiyar maanidar kirukkugal pathinetukkum kirigai nool 64.1st edition.Thamarai noolagam.Pg.94

translation: Catatonic excitement with tearing their dresses
definition: It is characterised by screams, runaway to the crematorium and beating, dancing, calling the demons names, tear the cloth, bite others and hectic for blood, running away with meaningless cry, swallowing crematorium ash, crying lonely. It may be explained by increased vatham. Of the seven udal thathukkal Saaram gets affected.
refn: Annonymous.1997.Agasthiyar maanidar kirukkugal pathinetukkum kirigai nool 64.1st edition.Thamarai noolagam.Pg.95

translation: Chronic Schizophrenia with wilderness and run amack
definition: It is characterised by obeisance to the unknown men, roaming in low hills and barren land, picks the wasted food, nodding the head frequently, closes the mouth, disobedience, eats anything given, scratchs the floor with nail, wets the cloth by urination and insomnia. It may be explained by increased vatham and pitham. Of the seven udal thathukkal Saaram gets affected.
refn: Annonymous.1997.Agasthiyar maanidar kirukkugal pathinetukkum kirigai nool 64.1st edition.Thamarai noolagam.Pg.82

translation: Chronic Schizophrenia with nakedness and smear faeces
definition: It is characterised by the symptoms of exhibitionism, soiling the dress and body with faecal matter, rolling himself on the floor, spitting on self and the other persons. It may be explained by increased pitham. Of the seven udal thathukkal Saaram gets affected.
refn: Annonymous.1997.Agasthiyar maanidar kirukkugal pathinetukkum kirigai nool 64.1st edition.Thamarai noolagam.Pg.83

translation: Chronic Schizophrenia with eating faeces and splashing water
definition: It is characterised by the symptoms of eating faecal matter, knocking the floor, spraying the water on his head with rejoice, eating ash, getting drenched under the rain, barking like a dog, blabbering and lamenting, making obeisance to the dog, eating the bitter and spittle things, protruding the tongue out and biting. It may be explained by increased vatham. Of the seven udal thathukkal Saaram gets affected.
refn: Annonymous.1997.Agasthiyar maanidar kirukkugal pathinetukkum kirigai nool 64.1st edition.Thamarai noolagam.Pg.84

translation: Chronic Schizophrenia with rolling in ashes and frothing in mouth
definition: It is characterised by confused state, biting other, wallowing on the ash, spray the slush over its head, frothy excretory mouth, singing, dancing and beating one who comes close to him, making cut injuries, making obeisance to the degraded persons and beating the honoured and noble persons. It may be explained by increased vatham. Of the seven udal thathukkal saaram gets affected.
refn: Annonymous.1997.Agasthiyar maanidar kirukkugal pathinetukkum kirigai nool 64.1st edition.Thamarai noolagam.Pg.87

translation: Chronic Schizophrenia with swimming in floor
definition: It is characterised by getting panic while approaching water, somersaulting frequently, always strolling in and out, tasting the pica, smiling and making obeisance on seeing the persons wearing ornaments and following them, insomnia. It may be explained by increased vatham. Of the seven udal thathukkal saaram gets affected.
refn: Annonymous.1997.Agasthiyar maanidar kirukkugal pathinetukkum kirigai nool 64.1st edition.Thamarai noolagam.Pg.88

translation: Chronic Schizophrenia with pelting stones and crying
definition: It is characterised by moaning with closed eyes, crying with throwing stones, gets submerged in water, undressed, running frequently, uttering lies, biting the babies, hugging everybody appealing to them, appearing always naked, dribbling of saliva, linking and tolling of the eyeball, throwing stones, running after children on seeing them with opened mouth. It may be explained by increased vatham. Of the seven udal thathukkal saaram gets affected.
refn: Annonymous.1997.Agasthiyar maanidar kirukkugal pathinetukkum kirigai nool 64.1st edition.Thamarai noolagam.Pg.89

definition: It is characterised by symptoms like modesty to the fellow beings even on the creatures and serpents, taking more food, doing any work commanded by other expeditiously, beating the children and females and growling, improper walking, making obeisance to everyone, always brushes the teeth. It may be explained by increased vatham. Of the seven udal thathukkal saaram gets affected.
refn: Annonymous.1997.Agasthiyar maanidar kirukkugal pathinetukkum kirigai nool 64.1st edition.Thamarai noolagam.Pg.90

definition: It is characterised by symptoms like closing his eyes and keeping his extremities unmoved crying as vaa (come) and poo(go), pinching himself tearing and damaging his clothes, repeating the words what once said, rarely takes the food but eats the turmeric. It may be explained by increased pitham. Of the seven udal thathukkal saaram gets affected.
refn: Annonymous.1997.Agasthiyar maanidar kirukkugal pathinetukkum kirigai nool 64.1st edition.Thamarai noolagam.Pg.91

translation: Manica excitement with calling others and gulping water in excess
definition: It is characterised by symptoms like threatening by starring gaze, singing and uttering repeatedly the come, when he sees the persons, doing mockery and casting the attire, appears naked, drinking the water and beating the persons nearby, eating anything what he gets, unnecessary laughing and screaming. It may be explained by increased pitham. Of the seven udal thathukkal saaram gets affected.
refn: Annonymous.1997.Agasthiyar maanidar kirukkugal pathinetukkum kirigai nool 64.1st edition.Thamarai noolagam.Pg.92

translation: catatonic withdrawal with yawning and shutting tears
definition: It is characterised by pallor conjunctiva, yawning, frequent lacrimation, tapping the floor with hand, blabbering, lamenting, doing antics, sleeping, hiding, when he sees someone gets panic, if someone move closer he will immediately urinate in clothes, body seems to be obese. It may be explained by increased kabam. Of the seven udal thathukkal saaram gets affected.

definition: It is characterised by symptoms like scolding others, increased sexual secretions , smiling when seeing females, annoyed, aversion towards food, more likes to eat betel leaves, pallor body, speaks with sympathy as though to a familiar person, tears the cloth. It may be explained by derangement of kabam. It may be explained by increased kabam. Of the seven udal thathukkal saaram and senner gets affected.

definition: It is characterised by symptoms similar as delirum, chilled appearance with hyperhidrosis, lying unconscious without speech. It may be explained by derangement of vatham, pitham and kabam. Of the seven udal thathukkal all gets affected.
refn: Annonymous.1997.Agasthiyar maanidar kirukkugal pathinetukkum kirigai nool 64.1st edition.Thamarai noolagam.Pg.93

translation: Manica excitement with gulping water in excess
definition: It is characterised by symptoms like drinking more water and vomiting, sunken eyes, less intake of food, sings, dances and whirls himself, draws lines on the floor, dislike towards food, wallow and rolling all the time. It may be explained by derangement of vatham and pitham. Of the seven udal thathukkal saaram and senner gets affected.

definition: It occurs due to alcohol addiction and is characterised by symptoms in 4 stages. In first stage, the person is excited, enthusiastic, state of happiness, sharp mind, retrieves the lost memory, feels body warmth, energetic, sings and dances to exhibit the happiness. In the second stage, feels losing the energy level and happiness, intelligence level comes down, loses his normal behaviour and starts behaving aggressively and arrogantly. In the third stage, person becomes more aggressive and arroga

definition: It is characterised by disturbed sleep, dysponea, tremor, headache, bad dreams, perplexity, shivering, talking with dead persons and demons. It may be explained by derangement of vatham. Of the seven udal thathukkal, saaram gets affected.

definition: It is characterised by discolouration of the body (greenish yellow or colour of leaf juice), reddish discolouration of the chest and eyes, burning sensation, pyrexia, perspiration, lassitude, diarrhoea, thirst and perplexity. definition: It is characterised by vomiting, vibratory feeling of chest, hypersomnia, oedema with swollen eruptions. It may be explained by derangement of vatham and kabam. Of the seven udal thathukkal, saaram and senner gets affected.

definition: It is characterised by loss of intelligence, memory loss, tremor, grinding of teeth, blackish or sometimes reddish discolouration of body, fluttering and loss of normal brightness of the body. translation: cardiac disease due to vali with throbbing, constricting pain
definition: It is a disease condition characterized by pallor of face, facial edema, heaviness over the chest with pain,palpitation, phlegm in the throat.If chronic, heaviness in the chest, dyspnoea, continuous cough, vomiting may occur. This condition is caused due to fever following aggravation of vali in young age, that is, vali phase of life as per Siddha. Also, it may affect young and elderly people. It is explained by derangement of vali, affecting pranan,samanan,udanan,influencing Iyam affects Avalam

It occurs during pitha kalam (phase of life) as per Siddha It is explained by derangement of azhal ,influencing vali affects pranan,vyanan,udanan,samanan. Among the seven udal thathukkal, saram to kozhuppu is affected

definition: Eczema of Children Characterized pain in the joints,Utricaria,Oozing,emaciation.It is explained by increase in Pitha kuttram due to consumption of food substances causing Allergy which is the root cause of the disease and finally affecting the Vatha Kuttram in the body.Among Seven thathus Saaram, Senneer, Oon and Kozhuppu are majorly affected

translation: Dysentry of children classified under Vali

definition: It is characterised by Vomiting, giddiness, asphyxia, sore throat, fever, chillness of upper and lower limb, convulsion, diarrhoea, It may be explained by increased vali and azhal kutram decreased saaram, senneer,oon
refn: K.S.Murugesa mudhaliyar(1933), Balavagadam(1st ed),chennai eraiyatchiyalar govt publication, Page No.241

definition: It is characterised by Diarrhoea, Chillness of upper and lower limb, ear block, fever, diarrhoea like milk, It may be explained by increased vali and azhal kutram decreased saaram, senneer, oon
refn: K.S.Murugesa mudhaliyar(1933), Balavagadam(1st ed),chennai eraiyatchiyalar govt publication, Page No.244

translation: Dysentry of children classified under azhal
Dysentery due to putrefaction of Chyle
definition: It is characterised by Vomiting immediately after feeding milk, hyperpyrexia, decreased volume of blood/pallor, voice with decreased tone, unable to move upper and lower limb.It may be explained byincreased vali and Iyya kutram decreased saaram, senneer, oon
refn: K.S.Murugesa mudhaliyar(1933), Balavagadam(1st ed),chennai eraiyatchiyalar govt publication, Page No.247

translation: Digestive disorders of children classified under vali

definition: It is characterised by chillness of upper and lower limb, flatulence, crying, sweating, convulsions, yawning, ulcer in nose. It may be explained by increased vali and Iyya kutram
refn: K.S.Murugesa mudhaliyar(1933), Balavagadam(1st ed),chennai eraiyatchiyalar govt publication, Page No.50

definition: It is characterised by continuous vomiting and diarrhoea, yellowish discolouration of the body,sweating, generalised body pain, giddiness, chillness, asphyxia, sore throat
refn: K.S.Murugesa mudhaliyar(1933), Balavagadam(1st ed),chennai eraiyatchiyalar govt publication, Page No.50

definition: It is characterised by Flatulence with diarrhoea, seizure, don’t feed from mother, anxiety, vomiting, dryness of tongue, fever, palpitation, giddiness, prominent forehead and chest, abdominal distension, fever with diarrhoea, frothy vomiting. It may be explained by increased vali and Iyya kutram decreased saaram, senneer, oon
refn: K.S.Murugesa mudhaliyar(1933), Balavagadam(1st ed),chennai eraiyatchiyalar govt publication, Page No.52

definition: It is characterised by Shinning of face and the body, hyperpyrexia, don’t feed milk, reddish urine, constipation, seizure, giddiness, chillness of foot. It may be explained by increased azhal and Iyya kutram
refn: K.S.Murugesa mudhaliyar(1933), Balavagadam(1st ed),chennai eraiyatchiyalar govt publication, Page No.57

translation: Digestive disorders with accumulation of fluid
definition: It is characterised by Shivering and chillness of the body, head ache, shinning of face, excessive salivation, nausea, pruritic upper limb and lower limb, low pitched voice, increased weight gain, don’t feed mothers milk, dysentery, painful micturition, sweating all over the body, head ache, abdominal pain.It may be explained by increased vali and Iyya kutram increased saaram
refn: K.S.Murugesa mudhaliyar(1933), Balavagadam(1st ed),chennai eraiyatchiyalar govt publication, Page No.58

definition: It is characterised by Hyperpyrexia, head ache, flatulence, diarrhoea like milk, generalised oedema, vomiting, lie down like lettuce stem. It may be explained by increased vali and Iyya kutram ,decreased saaram,senneer,oon
refn: K.S.Murugesa mudhaliyar(1933), Balavagadam(1st ed),chennai eraiyatchiyalar govt publication, Page No.62

translation: Digestive disorders with constipation and anuria
definition: It is characterised by Loss of appetite, feed little quantity from mother, continuous crying, cough, internal fever, constipation, anuria, tiredness, yawning, head ache, abdominal pain sweating, flatulence. It may be explained by increased vali and Iyya kutram and decreased saaram
refn: K.S.Murugesa mudhaliyar(1933), Balavagadam(1st ed),chennai eraiyatchiyalar govt publication, Page No.64

translation: Digestive disorders with burning sensation all over the body
definition: It is characterised by Burning sensation all over the body, internal fever, heaviness of the body, micturating urine slowly, painful micturition, severe constipation. It may be explained by increased azhal and Iyya kutram increased saaram, senneer.
refn: K.S.Murugesa mudhaliyar(1933), Balavagadam(1st ed),chennai eraiyatchiyalar govt publication, Page No.68

translation: Digestive disorders with Pain in Ribs
definition: It is characterised by Intractable vomiting, hyperpyrexia, generalised body pain, yawning, muscle pain, sweating with inflammation of testis, thirst, crying, swelling over ribs. It may be explained by increased vali and azhal kutram decreased saaram.
refn: K.S.Murugesa mudhaliyar(1933), Balavagadam(1st ed),chennai eraiyatchiyalar govt publication, Page No.70

definition: It is characterised by Tiredness of upper and lower limb, convulsions, diarrhoea, chest pain vomiting, bruxism, giddiness. It may be explained by increased vali and Iyya kutram decreased saaram, senneer, oon, kozhuppu.
refn: K.S.Murugesa mudhaliyar(1933), Balavagadam(1st ed),chennai eraiyatchiyalar govt publication, Page No.

translation: Digestive disorders with Intercostal in drawings.
definition: It is characterised by Intermittent fever, fever with wheeze, insomnia, dyspnoea, hiccup, tachyphenia, don’t feed milk, death fearness about that child to others. It may be explained by increased azhal and Iyya kutram decreased saaram
refn: K.S.Murugesa mudhaliyar(1933), Balavagadam(1st ed),chennai eraiyatchiyalar govt publication, Page No.73

definition: It is characterised by Sudden fever, diarrhoea with pus, swelling of lower limb, wasting of muscle, skin, bone, nerves and reduces weight. It may be explained by increased azhal decreased Iyyam decreased saaram, senneer, oon, kozhuppu, enbu.
refn: K.S.Murugesa mudhaliyar(1933), Balavagadam(1st ed),chennai eraiyatchiyalar govt publication, Page No.75

translation: Digestive disorders of children classified under azhal
Digestive disorder with redness over the body
refn: K.S.Murugesa mudhaliyar(1933), Balavagadam(1st ed),chennai eraiyatchiyalar govt publication, Page No.56

definition: It is characterised by decreased hearing power, productive cough, severe body pain, diarrhoea with sore smell, abdominal distension with milk like diarrhoea, vomiting milk without digestion, chillness, giddiness, shrunk and ringing around eyes. It may be explained by increased vali and Iyya kutram decreased saaram, senneer, oon, kozhuppu.
refn: K.S.Murugesa mudhaliyar(1933), Balavagadam(1st ed),chennai eraiyatchiyalar govt publication, Page No.67

translation: Digestive disorder with swelling and fever
definition: It is characterised by Weight loss, cough, fever, rhinitis, abdominal distension, head ache, abdominal bloating with diarrhoea, giddiness. It may be explained by increased Iyyam and vali kutram decreased saaram, senneer, oon kozhuppu
refn: K.S.Murugesa mudhaliyar(1933), Balavagadam(1st ed),chennai eraiyatchiyalar govt publication, Page No.71

translation: Digestive disorder with swelling in eye and ear
definition: It is characterised by Swelling of eyes and nose, ulcer in tongue, continuous fever, pain in upper and lower limb, loss of appetite. It may be explained by increased vali and azhal kutram increased saaram, senner.
refn: K.S.Murugesa mudhaliyar(1933), Balavagadam(1st ed),chennai eraiyatchiyalar govt publication, Page No.80

translation: Digestive disorders of children classified under aiyam
Digestive disorder caused by increased Iyam
definition: It is characterised by Chillness of the body, pallor of the tongue, fever, anxiety, diarrhoea, flatulence, distressing often. It may be explained by increased Iyyam and decreased saaram, senneer, oon, kozhuppu.
refn: K.S.Murugesa mudhaliyar(1933), Balavagadam(1st ed),chennai eraiyatchiyalar govt publication, Page No.50

definition: It is characterised by Flatulence, crying, rotating eyes with anxiety, dullness of the body, chillness of the body below hip, sweating, vomiting, diarrhoea, abdominal pain, tiredness continuous crying, intermittent fever. It may be explained by increased vali and Iyya kutram decreased saran, senneer, oon.
refn: K.S.Murugesa mudhaliyar(1933), Balavagadam(1st ed),chennai eraiyatchiyalar govt publication, Page No.51

definition: It is characterised by Generalised oedema of the body, abdominal bloating, vomiting, diarrhoea, pain in thigh, fever, generalised body pain. It may be explained by increased vli and Iyya kutram decreased saaram, senneer, oon, kozhuppu.
refn: K.S.Murugesa mudhaliyar(1933), Balavagadam(1st ed),chennai eraiyatchiyalar govt publication, Page No.79

definition: It is characterised by Throat pain, refuse milk, ulcer in tongue with foul smell, fever, heat watery phlegm, blackish stools. It may be explained by increased vali and azhal kutram
refn: K.S.Murugesa mudhaliyar(1933), Balavagadam(1st ed),chennai eraiyatchiyalar govt publication, Page No.205

translation: Papules in the tongue classified under Vali

definition: It is characterised by Cough, dyspnoea, lacrimation of eyes, head ache, fever, refuse milk feeding, pricking pain in mouth, tongue, throat, tremor of head, unable to speak, increased phlegm in throat, always opening eyes, wheezing,vomiting, diarrhoea like colour of neem flower.It may be explained by increased vali and Iyya kutram decreased saaram, senneer, oon

translation: Zoonotic disease of children classified under Vali
Diarrheal disorders Caused due to Zoophilic infections.
definition: Thodam is a disease occurring in infants due to external malefic influences such as touch, vision during the first three months of birth to one year. It is characterized by diarrhoea, fever, excessive thirst, stomach discomfort, dysentery, and hiccup occurs. In seven udal thathukal the saram and seneer gets affected. It may be explained by aggravated vatham followed by aggravated pitham.
refn: K.S.Murugesa mudhaliyar(1933), Balavagadam(1st ed),chennai eraiyatchiyalar govt publication, Page No.13

definition: It is characterized by vomiting, diarrhoea, excessive thirst, excessive fever, and weight reduction occurs. It may be explained by aggravated vatham followed by aggravated pitham. In seven udal thathukal the saram and seneer gets affected.
refn: K.S.Murugesa mudhaliyar(1933), Balavagadam(1st ed),chennai eraiyatchiyalar govt publication, Page No.14

translation: Infection caused by short Plight sleeping Birds
definition: It is characterized by vomiting, diarrhoea, disturbed sleep, the child weeps continuously, the baby afraid of the persons in and around them. The child has excessive thirst, body tiredness present, weight loss and body weakness present. It may be explained by aggravated vatham followed by aggravated pitham. In seven udal thathukal the saram and seneer gets affected.
refn: K.S.Murugesa mudhaliyar(1933), Balavagadam(1st ed),chennai eraiyatchiyalar govt publication, Page No.17

definition: It is characterized by regurgitation of milk, gound present in both eyes, abdominal discomfort present. In addition to this heaviness of the head present. It may be explained by aggravated vatham followed by aggravated pitham. In seven udal thathukal the saram and seneer gets affected.
refn: K.S.Murugesa mudhaliyar(1933), Balavagadam(1st ed),chennai eraiyatchiyalar govt publication, Page No.19

translation: Infection caused by short Plight sleeping Birds with red eyes
definition: It is characterized by redness of eyes, the child weeps continuously, generalised body heat present and diarrhoea present. It may be explained by aggravated vatham followed by aggravated pitham. In seven udal thathukal the saram and seneer gets affected.
refn: K.S.Murugesa mudhaliyar(1933), Balavagadam(1st ed),chennai eraiyatchiyalar govt publication, Page No.20

translation: Infection caused by short Plight sleeping Birds
definition: It is characterized by dryness of the skin. In this type the child skin becomes very dry, vomiting occurs and weight reduction present. The diarrhoea ,dryness of the tongue present, the child have high fever and the fever spreads like a poison, that means the severity is very fast. In this type of thodam the childs voice will be changed, excessive thirst and headache will be present. It may be explained by aggravated Pitham followed by aggravated Iyyam. In seven udal thathukal the Saram and Sene
refn: K.S.Murugesa mudhaliyar(1933), Balavagadam(1st ed),chennai eraiyatchiyalar govt publication, Page No.20

definition: It is characterized by nausea and vomiting .In this type of thodam the child feels to disgust to see mothers face. It may be explained by aggravated Pitham followed by aggravated Iyyam. In seven udal thathukal the saram and seneer gets affected.
refn: K.S.Murugesa mudhaliyar(1933), Balavagadam(1st ed),chennai eraiyatchiyalar govt publication, Page No.21

translation: Infection caused by short aquatic birds
definition: It is characterized by dryness of the tongue, breathlessness present, the child avoid breast feeding, loss of sleep and excessive sweating present, regurgitation of milk occurs. It may be explained by aggravated Pitham followed by aggravated Iyyam.In seven udal thathukal the saram and seneer gets affected.
refn: K.S.Murugesa mudhaliyar(1933), Balavagadam(1st ed),chennai eraiyatchiyalar govt publication, Page No.22

translation: Diarrheal diseases caused by Droplet infection
definition: It is characterized by regurgitation of milk, giddiness, discoloration of the skin occurs, the child weeps continuously by seeing mothers face, and diarrhoea occurs many times. It may be explained by aggravated vatham followed by aggravated pitham. In seven udal thathukal the saram and seneer gets affected.
refn: K.S.Murugesa mudhaliyar(1933), Balavagadam(1st ed),chennai eraiyatchiyalar govt publication, Page No.25

definition: It is characterized by body weakness, regurgitation of milk, blackish discoloration of tongue and mouth occurs. A special feature of this thodam is that the thodam occurs in child when a women takes a child durig menstrual cycle. It may be explained by aggravated vatham followed by aggravated pitham. In seven udal thathukal the saram and seneer gets affected.
refn: K.S.Murugesa mudhaliyar(1933), Balavagadam(1st ed),chennai eraiyatchiyalar govt publication, Page No.27

translation: Infections caused due to Menstruating women
definition: It is characterized by excessive vomiting, excessive sweating, and diarrhoea occurs in green colour, excessive thirst ,dropsy, extreme fever, and lacrimation occurs. It may be explained by aggravated vatham followed by aggravated pitham. In seven udal thathukal the saram and seneer gets affected.
refn: K.S.Murugesa mudhaliyar(1933), Balavagadam(1st ed),chennai eraiyatchiyalar govt publication, Page No.31

translation: Infections caused due to Menstruating women
definition: It is characterized by excessive vomiting, sweating occurs in area like nose, and lips. Blackish discoloration of mouth occurs. In this type dark circles around the eyes is a special feature. It may be explained by aggravated vatham followed by aggravated pitham. In seven udal thathukal the saram and seneer gets affected.
refn: K.S.Murugesa mudhaliyar(1933), Balavagadam(1st ed),chennai eraiyatchiyalar govt publication, Page No.31

translation: Infections caused due to women suffering out of Termination of Pregnancy
definition: It is characterized by regurgitation of milk, body pain, neck pain, a bad odour occurs in body, weight reduction , diarrhoea, reddish discoloration of the skin, giddiness also present in this type of thodam. It may be explained by aggravated vatham followed by aggravated pitham. In seven udal thathukal the saram and seneer gets affected.
refn: K.S.Murugesa mudhaliyar(1933), Balavagadam(1st ed),chennai eraiyatchiyalar govt publication, Page No.32

translation: Zoonotic disease of children classified under Azhal
Infection caused due to male birds
definition: It is characterized by excessive thirst, dryness of the skin, diarrhoea will be severe, and the child voice will be very husky. It may be explained by aggravated vatham followed by aggravated pitham. In seven udal thathukal the saram and seneer gets affected.
refn: K.S.Murugesa mudhaliyar(1933), Balavagadam(1st ed),chennai eraiyatchiyalar govt publication, Page No.13

definition: It is characterized by regurgitation of milk, indigestion ,dyspnea occurs. Fever present in whole body, dryness of tongue present, paleness present in both eyes, yellowish discoloration of face present. It may be explained by aggravated Pitham followed by aggravated Iyyam.In seven udal thathukal the saram and seneer gets affected.
refn: K.S.Murugesa mudhaliyar(1933), Balavagadam(1st ed),chennai eraiyatchiyalar govt publication, Page No.14

translation: Infection caused due to birds with sharp vision
definition: It is characterized by regurgitation of milk, and fever occurs intermittently. In this type of thodam the child feels difficult to see bright light. The child feels very tired, and always sees his mothers face. . It may be explained by aggravated vatham followed by aggravated pitham. In seven udal thathukal the saram and seneer gets affected.
refn: K.S.Murugesa mudhaliyar(1933), Balavagadam(1st ed),chennai eraiyatchiyalar govt publication, Page No.18

translation: Infection caused due to birds with white eyes
definition: It is characterized by paleness of the body, fever, diarrhoea occurs immediately after taking milk, the diarrhoea appears milky, and abdominal pain present. . It may be explained by aggravated vatham followed by aggravated pitham. In seven udal thathukal the saram and seneer gets affected.
refn: K.S.Murugesa mudhaliyar(1933), Balavagadam(1st ed),chennai eraiyatchiyalar govt publication, Page No.19

translation: Zoonotic disease of children classified under Aiyam
Infection caused due to birds causing dropsy
definition: It is characterized by edema present all over the body, dryness of the tongue present. vomitting occurs, the appearance is white and yellow in colour, and diarrhoea occurs in green and white colour. It may be explained by aggravated vatham followed by aggravated pitham. In seven udal thathukal the saram and seneer gets affected.
refn: K.S.Murugesa mudhaliyar(1933), Balavagadam(1st ed),chennai eraiyatchiyalar govt publication, Page No.16

translation: Infection caused due to birds during night
definition: It is characterized by tiredness present in the body especially in the evening, the child always look awake, extremities chillness present, discoloration of the skin present, and fever occurs. It may be explained by aggravated Pitham followed by aggravated Iyyam.In seven udal thathukal the saram and seneer gets affected.
refn: K.S.Murugesa mudhaliyar(1933), Balavagadam(1st ed),chennai eraiyatchiyalar govt publication, Page No.22

translation: Infections caused on seeing Menstruating women
definition: It is characterized by light fever, excessive sweating, abdominal pain present, vomiting present, the child avoid mothers milk, and diarrhoea also occurs.In this type of thodam the childs looks very lean. It may be explained by aggravated vatham followed by aggravated pitham. In seven udal thathukal the saram and seneer gets affected.
refn: K.S.Murugesa mudhaliyar(1933), Balavagadam(1st ed),chennai eraiyatchiyalar govt publication, Page No.31

translation: Zoonotic disease of children classified under Mukkutram

definition: It is characterized by weight loss, a bad odour occurs in the body, the child avoid mothers milk, the child feels disgusting to see mothers face, diarrhoea, vomiting presents.In this type of thodam the head of the child will be overweight, and the body feels very hot, discoloration of the skin occurs. It may be explained by aggravated Pitham followed by aggravated Iyyam.In seven udal thathukal the saram and seneer gets affected.
refn: K.S.Murugesa mudhaliyar(1933), Balavagadam(1st ed),chennai eraiyatchiyalar govt publication, Page No.25

translation: infection caused due to female birds
definition: It is characterized by paleness present in both eyes, breathlessness, giddiness, excessive sweating, loss of sleep, regurgitation of milk present. It may be explained by aggravated Pitham followed by aggravated Iyyam. In seven udal thathukal the saram and seneer gets affected.
refn: K.S.Murugesa mudhaliyar(1933), Balavagadam(1st ed),chennai eraiyatchiyalar govt publication, Page No.25

translation: infection caused due to male birds
definition: It is characterized by regurgitation of milk, diarrhoea occurs in green colour, the child weeps continuously and it sounds like a bird. It may be explained by aggravated vatham followed by aggravated pitham. In seven udal thathukal the saram and seneer gets affected.
refn: K.S.Murugesa mudhaliyar(1933), Balavagadam(1st ed),chennai eraiyatchiyalar govt publication, Page No.33

definition: It is characterized by redness of eyes,stomach discomfort, dryness of mouth present, excessive thirst present, ear block, breathlessness present, extremities dryness and hoarseness of voice present. In this type of thodam the child always look very lean. . It may be explained by aggravated Pitham followed by aggravated Iyyam.In seven udal thathukal the saram and seneer gets affected.
refn: K.S.Murugesa mudhaliyar(1933), Balavagadam(1st ed),chennai eraiyatchiyalar govt publication, Page No.34

translation: Seizures caused due to Digestive disorders
definition: In balavagadam 18 types of vallippu have been mentioned. A violent involuntary contraction or series of contractions of the voluntary muscles is known as convulsions. It is characterized by diarrhoea, gnasing the teeth,and spasmic pain occurs. . It may be explained by aggravated Pitham followed by aggravated Iyyam. In seven udal thathukal the saram and seneer gets affected.
refn: K.S.Murugesa mudhaliyar(1933), Balavagadam(1st ed),chennai eraiyatchiyalar govt publication, Page No.254

definition: It is characterized by staring with eyes widely opened, spasticity of the extremities, accumulation of the phlegm in the throat , dryness of the tongue and slurring of speech occurs. It may be explained by aggravated Iyyam.In seven udal thathukal the saram and seneer,enbu gets affected.
refn: K.S.Murugesa mudhaliyar(1933), Balavagadam(1st ed),chennai eraiyatchiyalar govt publication, Page No.255

definition: It is characterized by accumulation of the phlegm in the chest, breathlessness occurs. It may be explained by aggravated Iyyam. In seven udal thathukal the saram and seneer gets affected.
refn: K.S.Murugesa mudhaliyar(1933), Balavagadam(1st ed),chennai eraiyatchiyalar govt publication, Page No.256

definition: It is characterized by accumulation of the phlegm in the forehead. In this type of convulsions the seizure occurs frequently. In this type excessive sweating will be present in areas like head, neck and face. It may be explained by aggravated Iyyam. In seven udal thathukal the saram and seneer gets affected.
refn: K.S.Murugesa mudhaliyar(1933), Balavagadam(1st ed),chennai eraiyatchiyalar govt publication, Page No.257
